noun.description: Something that deviates from what is standard, normal, or expected.
examples: there are a number of anomalies in the present system
the apparent anomaly that those who produced the wealth were the poorest

noun.description: The angular distance of a planet or satellite from its last perihelion or perigee.

origin: Late 16th century: via Latin from Greek anōmalia, from anōmalos (see anomalous).
